title: SEA-HELM: Southeast Asian Holistic Evaluation of Language Models
author: Yosephine Susanto (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Adithya Venkatadri Hulagadri (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Jann Railey Montalan (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Jian Gang Ngui (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Xian Bin Yong (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Weiqi Leong (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Hamsawardhini Rengarajan (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Peerat Limkonchotiwat (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore), Yifan Mai (Center for Research on Foundation Models, Stanford University), William Chandra Tjhi (AI Singapore, National University of Singapore)
background: Developing a comprehensive evaluation suite that assesses the linguistic and cultural competencies of Large Language Models (LLMs) specifically targeting Southeast Asian languages.
contribution: SEA-HELM introduces a holistic evaluation framework comprising five core pillars to solve the challenge of inadequate benchmarks for Southeast Asian languages, achieving a systematic method for multilingual evaluation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing benchmarks primarily focus on high-resource languages and often use machine translation for lower-resource languages, leading to a lack of cultural representation and linguistic accuracy.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates localized datasets and community involvement, ensuring culturally relevant evaluation for Southeast Asian languages, which improves authenticity and relevance.

key_innovation: Incorporates community participation to ensure cultural authenticity and linguistic accuracy in evaluating LLMs.
real_world_impact: This framework serves as a significant resource for AI practitioners in Southeast Asia, enhancing the performance and safety of LLM applications across diverse languages and cultures.
limitations: The evaluation is not exhaustive in language coverage and is based on single model runs without published error bars.

new_terms.SEA: **Southeast Asia**, a region of Asia that includes countries like Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam, and the Philippines.
new_terms.LLM: **Large Language Models**, artificial intelligence models that are trained to understand and generate human language.

open_sourcing: The SEA-IFEval and SEA-MTBench datasets are planned to be released under the Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike 4.0 license.
